text: ['3.2.4  Export subsidies and promotion', '3.67.  The Central African Republic applies the VAT zero rate regime and the various suspensive regimes envisaged at community level (common report, Chapter 3); it has not implemented any other export advantages; it has only instituted import tax and customs benefits for production by enterprises  approved  under  the  Investment  Charter  (section  3.3.1  below).  The CAR  has  no  free zones.', '3.68.  According to the authorities, thought is being given to introducing export incentives.']

['3.2.4  Export subsidies and promotion', '3.63.  Apart  from  the  zero  rate  of  VAT  and  the  various  suspensory  procedures  provided  for at Community level (common report, Chapter 3), the Congo has not established any other benefits for  exports.  The  Congo  does  not  have  any  operational  free  zones  although,  according to the authorities,  the  establishment  of  special  economic  zones  is  under  way  in  Brazzaville and Oyo-Ollombo, in the Central Basin.', '3.64.  The  task  of  the  Congolese  Foreign  Trade  Centre  (CCCE),  established  in  1972113,  is to promote  exports,  support  economic  operators  by  providing  them  with  market  access intelligence,  and  help to  develop  partnership  agreements.  The  CCCE  supports', 'them', '105 Order No. 2731/MEFE/MEFB of 17 March 2004. 106 The contribution is CFAF 75/m3 for Congolese timber, CFAF 250/m3 for timber from outside the', 'CEMAC, and CFAF zero/m3 for CEMAC timber.', '107 Article 18 of Law No. 7-94 of 1 June 1994. 108 Contract No. 009/2006/PR/AO/DGTT of 20 July 2006. 109 Article 48 of Law No. 16-2000 of 20 November 2000. 110 Article 80 of Law No. 4-2005 of 11 April 2005. 111 Kimberly Process (2006). "Kimberley Process Removes the Republic of Congo from the', 'List of Participants".', '112 According to the authorities, in practice this provision of the 2012 Finance Law is not applied.', 'The 2013 Finance Law makes no reference to this matter.', '113 Law No. 23-2005 of 30 December 2005.', '\x0cWT/TPR/S/285 • CONGO', '- 220 -', 'the participation  of  Congolese  economic  operators  at  trade  fairs  and  similar  events.  The  CCCE is essentially funded by an annual State subsidy.']
